instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG? This is vcore going to the CPU’s integrated graphics processor for CPUs that have an integrated GPU. When this is missing on a device that has an integrated GPU and no discrete GPU, it usually means either no screen is detected, or the GPU integrated into the CPU is dead..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Hello, 

got <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A here. No chime, fans slowly ramping up to full speed, green and orange light present. All rails present. DCIN board had some junk stuff which was cleared, few probe points on the motherboard also had green-ish stuff on it, cleared with tweezers.

Mouse activity on USB port - Yes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
PRAM reset done?
If still no chime, try other LIO board.
Missing chime and ramping up the fan is more than audio problem on LIO board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I did PRAM, no change. 
I'll get another LIO board then and report back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Okay, tried new LIO board, same thing. No improvement whatsoever.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: New flex too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Nope. I need to buy it too? Looks clean.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Look at flex connectors and MLB connector under microscope.
Check if all pins are OK.

USB mouse is not 100% perfect indication for activity.
Remove SSD and start with USB OSX.
If the LED of such pendrive flashes, there is surely USB activity.
Then you can start to work on image/backlight part.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: I'll try to upload a pic here as well as check under a microscope.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
No Title

Okay, flex cable looks like it had some green-ish stuff. Clean with iso?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Connected external drive through USB, LED on it lights up and stays on. Fans still full speed. Internal SSD is removed. Flex cable cleaned with iso. Checked J4700 with diode mode, nothing seems awkward, yet I don't know the values cause I don't have other board, but everything was pretty much around 0.35-0.4V, except few grounds I guess.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
If external drive doesn't flash, there is no activity; board is stuck.
Be sure that drive has bootable OSX, or something else like ASD...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I do not understand "if external drive doesn't flash, there is no activity"

Sorry if I haven't written in the first post, but to add to no chime, there is no image on screen too. 

The external drive has LED on it and it lights up. I use it for other Macs, works fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
When booting, that drive should flash one LED, isn't?
Or is an HDD to USB adapter with only one LED for power?
Some adapters have two LEDs; one for power, other for link.
If there is no USB activity, board is stuck, you can't get image, nor backlight.
Should dig more on it...

Use USB port from MLB.
It should work without LIO flex connected.
Only needs the 5 pins power cable from LIO...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
The external drive is an SSD in the enclosure. It has only one LED. I can try and see on other Macs if it will keep flashing when being used, which I believe it should. 

I've used USB from the motherboard, didn't work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Check if all voltages are present.
Pin4 of <CHIP>U2750</CHIP>/60 get high level on both?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
All voltages are present except <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL>. 
3.3V on those pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I don't exactly know the behavior of this board.
But I remember several <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards which give LCD image without AXG voltage on corresponding coil.
Maybe AXG power supply gets in use only when graphics load increases.
And this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is Ivy Bridge too...

So be sure first about USB activity.
You can also try new BIOS.

Look at USB mouse light and see if reacts at PRAM reset.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I’ll try that with mouse light and PRAM. 
As for BIOS IC, can it be inserted directly to programmer? I don’t think I have an adapter that big.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Back to this board. 

<RESISTOR>R7644</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7645</RESISTOR> were looking funky, I've replaced with new.

Now I don't have any USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
You messed something there, if had USB activity before.
Do you get correct voltage at L7630 now?
Soldered correct values for <RESISTOR>R7644</RESISTOR>/45?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Yes, correct values on R644/45. I've replaced them now with new ones.
L7630 is 1.05V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Did you really have USB actibity before?
If yes, then check what you've touched, maybe ripped off something...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I plugged the other mouse last time and got mouse activity. This time I plugged a different gaming mouse, no activity. 

Now I plugged back the old mouse, there IS mouse activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Maybe is no activity, sometime USB mouse is not relevant.
Use an OSX pendrive with link LED; if that starts to flash, you have USB activity for sure.

For WSON8 chips I already posted photos with my adapter, few days ago
[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/40584-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-boot-loop[/url]

Let us know any change after BIOS is done.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
No Title

I don't have USB with link LED at the moment. But it's on the way. 

In the meantime, I've soldered BIOS chip using the adapter, but in the programmer, all it says is an unknown device. 

BIOS pin 1 was where tweezers show.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Did you put kapton tape in the middle?
You must tap part of pads, or central pad of WSON8 chip will short the pads...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Nope, I didn't put tape. First time I hear about it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: You have a link for WSON8-DIP8 "fast" adapter above...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Back to this one. I've tried now USB drive with LED on it. Drive flashes when being used/working. 

When I use it on this board, it just stays ON. Never flashes, so I guess no USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Yeah, board doesn't really boot.
Did you finally try new BIOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Yes, just tried new BIOS from Ghostlyhaks. No change. Orange light, fans ramp up slowly. No USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: I'm pretty much stuck here. I've got another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> working. Maybe just go crazy and go through the whole board with measures? Or is there something that should turn on to tell it to give some sign of life?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Does anyone have any clue?
